verb.description: Cause (someone) to become motionless with horror, wonder, or astonishment.
examples: he was transfixed by the pain in her face

verb.description: Pierce with a sharp implement or weapon.
examples: a field mouse is transfixed by the curved talons of an owl

origin: Late 16th century (in transfix (sense 2)): from Latin transfix- pierced through, from the verb transfigere, from trans- across + figere fix, fasten.
